patterns.name: React Component Success Pattern
patterns.description: Modular React component structure with hooks and TypeScript
key_elements: Unit tests with Jest/React Testing Library

patterns.name: Express API Success Pattern
patterns.description: RESTful API with Express.js, proper middleware, and error handling

patterns.name: Python CLI Success Pattern
patterns.description: Command-line interface with argparse and modular architecture

patterns.name: JWT Refresh Token Rotation with Family ID
patterns.description: Prevent stolen refresh tokens from being reused indefinitely by tracking token families
patterns.use_case: Prevent unlimited token reuse, detect compromises, force re-authentication on breach
key_elements: Replay attack detection (old token used after new issued)
Grace period for legitimate token rotation
patterns.implementation: Store family ID with each refresh token, track token chain in ZSET, detect replay by checking if old token has newer sibling, revoke entire family on compromise
tradeoffs: Adds database lookup per refresh
Requires token family tracking schema
Users must re-authenticate if compromise detected (good for security)

patterns.name: WhatsApp Webhook Signature Verification
patterns.description: Verify webhook authenticity using HMAC-SHA1 signature with timing attack prevention
patterns.use_case: Prevent webhook spoofing attacks, ensure messages come from Meta, protect against fake orders/commands
key_elements: Raw body capture before JSON parsing
HMAC-SHA1 signature computation with app secret
Proper error handling (return 200 even on failure)
patterns.implementation: Middleware captures request stream before JSON parsing, extracts X-Hub-Signature header, computes HMAC-SHA1 using raw body, uses crypto.timingSafeEqual for comparison, stores message ID for replay detection
tradeoffs: Must capture raw body early (before JSON middleware)
Adds signature verification overhead (~1-2ms)
Requires storing message IDs in database
benefits: Verifies webhook authenticity with cryptographic proof
Prevents timing attacks on signature comparison

patterns.name: Rate Limiting with Redis Sliding Window
patterns.description: Efficient rate limiting using Redis ZSET with sliding window algorithm
patterns.use_case: Prevent API abuse, protect expensive operations (e.g., WhatsApp broadcasts), limit brute force attacks
key_elements: Redis ZSET for O(log n) request counting
Sliding window (not fixed window) for accuracy
patterns.implementation: ZADD request timestamps to ZSET, ZCOUNT requests in window, ZREMRANGEBYSCORE old requests, use per-endpoint configuration for limits/windows, return remaining quota in headers
tradeoffs: Redis dependency required
Extra database lookup per request
May fail open if Redis unavailable

cost_protection_example.mitigation: Rate limit /orders/:id/confirm to 100/day, prevents accidental mass broadcast

patterns.name: React Form Validation with Toast Notifications
patterns.description: Client-side form validation with real-time error display and Toast notifications using Sonner
patterns.use_case: Add comprehensive validation and user-friendly error handling to any form (login, register, profile, etc.)
key_elements: Specific error messages for each scenario
implementation: Create validation utility file (lib/validation-errors.ts) with specific error parsers
Create custom hook (hooks/use-notifications.ts) for Toast integration
Add real-time validation on onChange with error state management
Display field errors with conditional styling (red border)
Show Toast on API errors with parseError utility
Unit test all validation functions (100% coverage target)
Clear errors when user switches tabs/sections
benefits: Better UX with specific error messages in user's language
Reduces unnecessary API calls (client validation first)
Reusable validation functions for other forms
tradeoffs: Adds extra validation layer (small performance impact)
Requires mapping API errors to user messages
Must keep client and server validation in sync
error_types_handled: Email format validation (accepts emails and phone numbers)
API error classification (email exists, user not found, network error)

example_errors.invalid_email: Format email tidak valid. Gunakan email yang benar atau nomor WhatsApp.
example_errors.email_exists: Email ini sudah terdaftar. Silakan login atau gunakan email lain.
example_errors.invalid_credentials: Email atau password salah. Silakan coba lagi.
example_errors.password_too_short: Password minimal 8 karakter. Gunakan kombinasi huruf, angka, dan simbol.
example_errors.network_error: Gagal terhubung ke server. Periksa koneksi internet Anda.

patterns.reusability: High - can be adapted for any form with field-level validation

patterns.name: Indonesia Personal Data Protection Law (UU 27/2022) Compliance
patterns.description: Compliance pattern for Indonesia GDPR including consent, retention, erasure, and audit logging
patterns.use_case: Operate legally in Indonesia with personal data protection compliance
key_elements: Data retention schedule (active vs inactive, 30/7 day windows)
Auto-deletion jobs (inactive users, old trips, audit logs)
Right to erasure (30-day grace period, hard delete)
Right to data access (JSON export endpoint)
patterns.implementation: Consent table with version tracking, auto-deletion scheduler (Cron/Bull), soft delete with 30-day recovery window, hard delete after grace, data export endpoint, audit log table with all sensitive operations
tradeoffs: Adds database schema complexity
Requires background jobs for cleanup
30-day grace period delays hard deletion

patterns.name: React Modal Dialog with Tabs
patterns.description: Reusable modal dialog component with tab navigation for displaying multi-section content
patterns.use_case: Display terms & conditions and privacy policy in modal dialog with easy tab switching
key_elements: Modal overlay with fixed positioning and semi-transparent backdrop
Tab navigation at top to switch between sections
Scrollable content area with styled sections
implementation: Create component with isOpen and onClose props
Use useState for activeTab (string) to track current section
Return null if not isOpen (no DOM rendering)
Create fixed overlay: bg-black/50 with z-50
Main dialog card with max-width and max-height constraints
Tab buttons with conditional orange color/border on active
Content area with overflow-y-auto for scrolling
Conditional rendering based on activeTab state
Close button with onClick handler

structure.tabs: Flex button group with active indicator (orange border)
structure.content: Scrollable div with sections containing headings and paragraphs

styling_details.overlay: fixed inset-0 bg-black/50 flex items-center justify-center z-50
styling_details.dialog: bg-white rounded-2xl shadow-2xl max-w-2xl max-h-[90vh] flex flex-col

benefits: Reusable component for any multi-tab content
Clean separation of concerns (tab state management)
Good UX with tab switching and scrollable content

props_interface.activeTab: state managed inside component (can be extracted to parent)

patterns.integration: Call component with state: <Dialog isOpen={isOpen} onClose={() => setIsOpen(false)} />

patterns.name: React Terms & Conditions Checkbox Validation
patterns.description: Validate checkbox acceptance and display user-friendly error messages with visual feedback
patterns.use_case: Require users to accept terms and conditions before submitting registration form
key_elements: Separate state for checkbox (checked) and error (message)
Validate checkbox in form validation function
Auto-clear error when user checks the checkbox
Visual error states (red background, border, text color)
Clear error when user switches tabs/forms
Hover effect for better UX when no error
implementation: Add state: termsAccepted (boolean) and termsError (string | null)
Add validation in validateAllFields() that checks termsAccepted only for registration
Connect input onChange to update both termsAccepted and auto-clear error
Conditionally apply red styling: 'bg-red-50 border border-red-200' when termsError
Display error banner with AlertCircle icon below checkbox
Clear termsError when switching tabs or starting new form submission

validation_logic.error_message: Anda harus menyetujui Syarat & Ketentuan dan Kebijakan Privasi

styling.container: flex items-start gap-2 p-3 rounded-lg transition-colors

user_flow: 1. User sees checkbox with hover effect
2. User tries to submit without checking â†’ error appears
3. Error shows in red banner with AlertCircle icon
4. User checks checkbox â†’ error auto-clears
benefits: Clear user feedback on validation error
Auto-clear error on user action (improves UX)
edge_cases: Don't validate terms on login form (only registration)
Clear terms error when switching between login/register
Auto-clear error immediately when checkbox is checked

patterns.name: Express.js Authentication Security Hardening (Phase A)
patterns.description: Complete rate limiting + security headers + generic error messages to prevent brute force, enumeration, and XSS attacks
patterns.use_case: Secure authentication endpoints against brute force, user enumeration, and application-level attacks with minimal code changes
key_elements: Rate limiting on auth endpoints (login, register, refresh, username check)
Generic error messages preventing user enumeration
Helmet security headers (CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options, etc.)
Graceful error handling with rate limit headers
CSP configuration allowing HTTPS CDN (e.g., R2, Cloudflare)
implementation: Install helmet: pnpm add helmet@7.1.0
Create rate limiters for: login (5/15min), register (3/1hour), refresh (10/5min), username (20/1min)
Apply rate limiters as middleware BEFORE validation on auth routes
Replace specific errors ('Email already registered', 'User not found') with generic 'Authentication failed'
Configure helmet with CSP allowing imgSrc: ['https:'], disable crossOriginEmbedderPolicy for CDN
Set HSTS maxAge to 31536000 (1 year) and preload: true for production
file_changes: src/index.ts: Import helmet, apply middleware after CORS
src/routes/auth.ts: Import createRateLimiter, create 4 limiter instances, apply to 4 routes
src/services/auth.service.ts: Change 3 error messages to generic 'Authentication failed'
benefits: Prevents brute force attacks (5 login attempts = 75 min until retry)
Prevents bot registration (3 attempts per hour only)
Prevents user enumeration (attacker can't tell if email exists)
Prevents XSS, clickjacking, MIME sniffing via CSP + security headers
tradeoffs: Rate limiter uses in-memory store (scales to ~10k concurrent users, then consider Redis)
Generic errors might confuse some users (mitigated by clear frontend messages)
CSP might require whitelisting external resources in future

testing.unit_tests: Test rate limiter blocks after max attempts
testing.integration_tests: Verify security headers on all responses
manual_tests: curl -I https://api.domain/health â†’ check security headers
Login 6 times â†’ should block on 6th
Register 4 times â†’ should block on 4th
Test R2 image loading â†’ should work (CSP allows https:)

patterns.rollback_plan: Time to rollback: ~3 minutes. Remove helmet middleware, remove rate limiters, revert error messages.

deployment_notes.staging_test: Verify all security headers and rate limits work
deployment_notes.production: Monitor error logs for rate limit false positives

improvement_from_baseline.user_enumeration_risk: ðŸ”´ Critical â†’ ðŸŸ¢ Very Low
improvement_from_baseline.xss_risk: ðŸŸ¡ Medium â†’ ðŸŸ¢ Very Low
improvement_from_baseline.clickjacking_risk: ðŸ”´ Critical â†’ ðŸŸ¢ Very Low

patterns.name: React Form Error Handling with API Response Mapping
patterns.description: Display API errors (both field-level and general) with proper mapping to form fields and UI notifications
patterns.use_case: Handle API errors when form submission fails and display them appropriately in the UI
key_elements: Parse API error response (both simple errors and validation arrays)
Map error codes to specific form fields (email, password, etc.)
Separate field-level errors from general errors
Display field errors below inputs with red border styling
Display general errors in error banner at top of form
Clear errors when user switches form sections or tabs
Clear previous errors before new submission
implementation: Create error parsing function that handles multiple error formats
Return both fieldErrors (mapped to specific inputs) and generalError (banner display)
Map error codes to field paths (email_exists -> email field, invalid_credentials -> general)
Store general error in separate state from field errors
Display red error banner with AlertCircle icon for general errors
Add field error display below each input with red border on error state
Clear generalError state when user clicks tab switch or resets form

error_handling_patterns.field_errors: Shown directly below input with red styling, cleared on focus
error_handling_patterns.general_errors: Shown in banner at top of form, cleared on new submission
api_response_formats: Validation array: { details: [{ path: 'email', message: 'Email exists' }] }

code_structure.error_parsing: parseAuthError() handles multiple error message formats and codes
code_structure.field_mapping: Error codes mapped to fields via regex on error message content
code_structure.ui_elements: Error banner component with icon + field error paragraphs below inputs
code_structure.state_management: Separate fieldErrors dict and generalError string state

benefits: Users see specific field errors (email field gets email errors)
General errors (network, auth failures) display in prominent banner
Errors cleared when context changes (tab switch, new submission)
Works with both validation errors and API business logic errors
Consistent error messaging in Indonesian for better UX
tradeoffs: Requires error parsing function maintenance if API error format changes
Must keep field mapping logic in sync with API error types
Cannot distinguish between certain errors (e.g., network vs auth) at first glance
